claim: Donald Trump was the most recent U.S. president not selected as Time's Person of the Year.

supporting.text: Donald Trump was the U.S. president from 2017 to 2021, and Time's Person of the Year for 2020 was Joe Biden, who was president-elect at the time.

attacks.text: Donald Trump was the U.S. president from 2017 to 2021, and Time's Person of the Year for 2020 was Joe Biden, who was president-elect at the time.
Time's Person of the Year is not strictly about being the current U.S. president, but about influence, so Trump could still have been selected in 2020 despite not being president-elect.
Time's selection of Joe Biden in 2020 was explicitly tied to his role as president-elect, making Trump's non-selection as the outgoing president logically consistent with the claim.
The claim specifies 'most recent,' but if another non-president was selected after Trump's term, the claim would be false.
No non-president has been selected as Time's Person of the Year since Trump left office, validating the claim's accuracy.

supporting.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2021 was Elon Musk, and for 2022 was Volodymyr Zelensky, neither of whom were U.S. presidents, confirming Trump as the most recent U.S. president not selected.

attacks.text: Time's Person of the Year for 2021 was Elon Musk, and for 2022 was Volodymyr Zelensky, neither of whom were U.S. presidents, confirming Trump as the most recent U.S. president not selected.
Joe Biden was U.S. president in 2021 and 2022 but was not selected as Time's Person of the Year, making him the most recent U.S. president not selected, not Trump.
The claim specifies 'most recent U.S. president not selected,' which refers to the last president before the current one (Biden), which would still be Trump.

supporting.text: Barack Obama, Trump's predecessor, was Time's Person of the Year in 2008 and 2012, making Trump the most recent U.S. president not selected.

attacks.text: Barack Obama, Trump's predecessor, was Time's Person of the Year in 2008 and 2012, making Trump the most recent U.S. president not selected.
Joe Biden, Trump's successor, was also not selected as Time's Person of the Year in 2020 or 2021, making Biden the most recent U.S. president not selected.
Time's Person of the Year selection is not strictly annual for U.S. presidents, and Trump was featured on Time's cover multiple times, which may imply recognition similar to the award.

supporting.text: Time's selection criteria often favor transformative or controversial figures, and while Trump was controversial, he was not selected, unlike his successor Joe Biden in 2020.

attacks.text: Time's selection criteria often favor transformative or controversial figures, and while Trump was controversial, he was not selected, unlike his successor Joe Biden in 2020.
Trump was selected as Time's Person of the Year in 2016, which contradicts the claim that he was not selected.
The claim specifies 'most recent U.S. president not selected,' and Trump was selected in 2016, so the claim is still valid for his non-selection after his presidency.
Time's Person of the Year selection is not strictly about U.S. presidents, so the claim's focus may be misleading.

supporting.text: Historical records show that every U.S. president since George W. Bush (2000 and 2004) has been selected at least once, except for Donald Trump, making him the most recent exception.

attacks.text: Historical records show that every U.S. president since George W. Bush (2000 and 2004) has been selected at least once, except for Donald Trump, making him the most recent exception.

Time's Person of the Year is not strictly about U.S. presidents, and non-presidents like Mark Zuckerberg (2010) or Greta Thunberg (2019) have been selected, so the claim's focus on presidents is misleading.
The claim is factually correct about U.S. presidents, as no other president after George W. Bush has been excluded from Time's selection except Trump.
Time's selection criteria are subjective and not a definitive measure of a president's significance, so the claim lacks meaningful context.
While subjective, Time's Person of the Year is a widely recognized cultural benchmark, making the claim relevant for comparative analysis.
